data.title: Good food good environment
data.text: Food is always great. Occasionally short staffed but worth the wait. All enchiladas are always good.

data.title: That bus boy needs a raise!
data.text: Manny's is one of our family's favorites. Love love love the food.  I can honestly say I haven't had a bad meal here. Queso, burritos, enchiladas, fajitas, chimicanga...all delicious. My one overwhelming concern is the steady decline in service we have experienced over the last year or so. Our last three visits over the last few month have involved subpar service. From lack of friendliness and attentiveness I'm surprised more isn't being done to ensure improvement of customer service.  This Friday night specifically was no different in terms of crappy service.  At 8:26pm there were several tables occupied and what seemed to be plenty of servers. However, there was one kid busting tables and working his butt off. He also happened to be the only person able to pass out chips. Apparently, that task is beneath the waitstaff as we recieved our queso before chips and then later on our empty chip basket sat on table for almost five minutes as three waiters plus the manager walked by...and nothing. After the bus boy, mentioned previously, cleared and cleaned four tables he got us our chips. Thanks kid! You worked your butt off while everyone else sat at the bar or on the stools by the hostess area watching the Olympics. Again, food is great, but the service is questionable at best.  Oh, one more thing...though there was no one waiting to be seated, our waitress removed my plate as I was mid-bite....chip in hand I literally had to move my hand over her arm.  If this doesn't say things need to be looked at and fixed, I don't know what does.  We will give it a few more chances before we switch to somewhere else for good.

data.title: Good quality Mexican FOod
data.text: We had a family meal at Manny's and it was enjoyed by all. The burritos, enchiladas, tortilla soup, and the chicken quesadillas were all good. The atmosphere was what you wuld expect at a Mexican restaurant. Good, fun décor and a full bar.

data.title: Good Tex Mex food, good daily specials
data.text: Manny's has good food, good margaritas and good prices.  When they have the buffet as the daily special, give it a try.  The specials are listed outside on a board so you can see when driving by.  Give them a try.

data.title: Great Mexican dishes.
data.text: The Mexican dishes are very good but a little pricey. We have gotten coupons in the mail so we use them. They also have a bar but have not used it.

data.title: First time visit
data.text: Manny's was recommended by my son.  He eats there before each FC Dallas game.  I was very impressed!  The food was excellent.  I always judge a Mexican place by the chips and salsa.  They passed with flying colors.  My quesadilla was really good.  The atmosphere was quaint and festive.  The wait staff was very friendly.  I will be visiting again.  I highly recommend.

data.title: FCS Championship Visit
data.text: Manny's is a long time hang out for locals to get their Tex-Mex fix. I had the Manny's plate which will be a fair size meal! Salsa is slightly sweet. Atmosphere is comfortable and good location on Main Street just as you enter the older section of Frisco. Food is good and service is friendly. Weber was there when I visited and he was very friendly and wanted to make sure everything was satisfied.

data.title: Okay Tex-mex
data.text: This was an impulse dinner stop and I kind of wished we had kept driving.  The food was not horrible, but it wasn't really memorable either.  The staff was friendly and they had live music.  I had the flautas and my husband had the chimichanga.  My daughter got the kids mac n' cheese and it looked like it was drenched in nacho cheese.  She didn't really eat any of it.  The food did come out piping hot, though.  We probably wouldn't eat here again though.

data.title: Could be an exception, but not a very good experience
data.text:
I took my family here last month during a warm Texas Friday evening.  The A/C must not have been working very well because it was very warm inside.  In addition, there were numerous flies trying to land on our food and drinks which made for a very unpleasant evening.  The wife and kids spent the entire time swatting flies, eating as fast as they could, and sweating due to the warm air.  I told them just leave whenever they are ready and I would stay behind to pay the bill.  It was the fastest and most unpleasant Friday family dinner in a long time

This was the first time at the new Manny's location.  I have eaten at their old location several times in the past without issues.

Hopefully, the fly problem was just an isolated occurrence, but my family won't even go in there anymore.

data.title: Fine for a lunch.. not the best around, but certainly not the worst.
data.text: Food is average but so is the price, so it's a fine place to go for lunch.  My son said that the chicken fingers were not good.  "Mom they were BROWN and they're supposed to be TAN."  I think that means they were over done.  He did not give it a thumbs up.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Great atmosphere, friendly staff.  Food was marginal at best.  We came in at 6 pm. We had fajitas but the meat seemed as though it was recooked from lunch.  The meat was overlooked and dry. The dab of guacamole we had was brown in spots and warm and just did not taste good.  First time eating at Manny's and I've been in the area a long time.  I doubt I will return.

data.title: Great service, food and fun
data.text: Top shelf margarita was great, had the beef tenderloin which was delicious....loved the live entertainment....even one of the waitresses got up and sang....and she had a great stage presence...

data.title: Slipping
data.text: Let me say first that I am a hard core regular, and have been for years, going back to the old location. That being said, I have noticed the food quality slipping the last two visits. The queso has changed, and the sauces on the enchiladas and chile rellenos has been too salty to eat. Service has also changed and I keep seeing lots of new faces on the wait staff. I'm going to give it one more try before I regrettably find a new tex mex locale.

data.title: Just what I was looking for!
data.text:
When I travel, I love to check out the local cuisine and when possible, I opt for family run restaurants. I found Manny's at the recommendation of a desk clerk at my extended stay hotel in Plano.

At first, the location seemed a little intimidating, but as soon as I walked through the door, I knew it was just what I was looking for. A young man was playing guitar and even though he didn't play Mexican themed music, it was easy, relaxing and fun. The owner's waited on the tables and visited with familiar faces, while also making me feel as if I had been there a hundred times. The decor was equally fun and bright. I loved the vibe of this place and would definitely return.  

The food was reasonably priced and well proportioned. It was also pretty tasty. I had the fajita trio and it was great! If I had one critique, it would be the salsa. I just didn't love it. They may want to consider switching to a fresher version, like those served at Moe's or one of the other franchise restaurants.

At the time of this writing, they offer live music on Tuesday from 6-9 PM and again on Fri/Sat. from 8-11:00 PM. They have $3.00 margaritas on Mon and Tues. and a buffet on Wed. from 5-8:00 PM for $11.95.  You can reach them at (972) 377-6765. I would definitely recommend it!

data.title: Good but nothing special
data.text: Service was slow. I think I waiter was given too many large groups to handle. He was friendly enough, I just think he was overloaded. The food was just basic Tex-Mex, nothing special. I will say that the refried beans were very good as was the chicken enchilada with a sour cream sauce.

data.title: Good Food, Good Times
data.text: Dine here regularly.  The food is always fresh and flavorful.  Live music on weekends is fun, with drinks specials.  The Sunday buffet is a great deal!

data.title: FUN!
data.text:
So let me start off this review by saying Kim, the owner, is so funny and nice!!  She made my visit here and I will definately be back!

When I walked in, I asked them about the advertisement online about Margarita Wenesday.  She told me they were actually new owners trying to get the website updated and they no longer did that special, however they would honor it, GREAT!  We sat at the bar and had Carlos get our first round of frozen margaritas.  In all honesty, the flavor was good, but there wasnt enough tequila in it.  I find this to be true with most premade margaritas, so I wasnt suprised.  I then tried the on the rocks margarita...and the frozen was better.  I prob wont have the margarita if I come here again as it wasnt worth the calories that I am sure are in it.

We ordered the cheese queso as an appetizer.  I mixed it with the salsa for a little more flavor.  The chips were nice and crispy and not greasy.  For entree I ordered the 2 enchilada plate and added a crispy taco.  The entree was great.  The chicken/sour cream enchilada had a lot of sauce on it, just how I like it, same with the cheese/chili con carne.  They were both really good and flavorful.  I could have used a little less salt, but seriously good.  Same with the taco.  Great flavor, little salty, but truly enjoyable.

Portion sizes were large, and I had leftovers, which I ate for breakfast this morning.  LOL!  I was going to eat for dinner, but when I opened the fridge it was calling my name.  The atmosphere was fun.  Like I said Kim is a HOOT!  They will be having entertainment there on certain nights and she proceeded to give us a shout out from the stage welcoming us as first timers to the restaurant.  Indeed a GREAT time.

The only reason I am not giving them a 5 is because of the margaritas and the salt level, but honestly If they allowed a 4.5 that is what I would give them.  Take your friends, take your family, kids....the food really is good.  I was told everything was made fresh daily.  My friend didnt mention her food being salty, so it might have just been my palate.  I will definately be back, and will be on the lookout for my new buddy Kim.  Good luck with your new venture

data.title: Excellent for lunch
data.text: Vary good and fast service with great food. Nice atmosphere. Definitely will return when in the area again.

data.title: Excellent Tex/Mex on Main Street
data.text:
Living nearby, this place is not one of our local favorite hangouts.
With prompt service, cold drinks, and over sized portions, we enjoy our visit each time.
They have specials during the week like Fajita night for 7.95 and kids entrees discounts on the weekends so take advantage!!

data.title: So much food!!
data.text: It was great even my picky daughter ate the hot sauce!  Lots of food, could not even finish half of my plate, and lets just say I can put a plate away! :)
